div.div: This file contains the text associated with the supplementary information.
div.p: (PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Functional groups for the JFRE Atlantis model.
div.p: Each functional group has its identifier ( Code). In addition, examples of the species that compose these groups are included, with their common and scientific name. The Management column describes whether the functional group has any interest for conservation management ( Conservation) or fisheries management ( Fishery).
(PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Bathymetric range distribution of the JFRE AgeClass functional groups of the Juan Fernández Ridge ecosystem.
div.p: (PDF)

div.div: Distribution of sharks based on the presence of these species in different areas.

div.div: Information used for the predator-prey relationships for the JFRE.
div.p: The functional group codes correspond to the codes used to identify the functional groups these codes come from S1 Table.
(PDF)

div.div: Date of release and pelagic larval duration for each modeled functional group.
div.p: (PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Vertical depth distribution.
div.p: The ontogenetic stages division for JF. morwong (BRC adult and Juvenil) was based on Rivara 2013 [ 104].
(PNG)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: JF. Morwong horizontal distribution by season.
div.p: The ontogenetic stages—adults (Left column) and juveniles (right column)—were based on Rivara 2013 [ 104].
(PNG)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Spiny lobster horizontal distribution by season.
div.p: The ontogenetic stages—adults (Left column) and juveniles (right column)—were based the size at first maturity estimated by Ernst et al. 2016 [ 50].
(PNG)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Golden crab horizontal distribution by season.
div.p: The ontogenetic stages—adults (Left column) and juveniles (right column)—were based on size at first maturity estimated by Guerrero and Arana 2009 [ 105].
(PNG)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Time series of rainfall used for forcing the nutrients in Atlantis JFRE.
div.p: The 90 th percentile represents the extreme rainfall events.

div.div: Time series of the proporcion of sea urching in the realized diet of moray eels.
div.p: (PNG)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Relative effect of moray eels predation on the population of sea urchin.
div.p: The black dots represent the relative biomass of sea urchin under the predation effect of moray eels. The dotted grey line represents the relative biomass of sea urchin without the predator effect of moray eels. Both time series are relative to the initial biomass of sea urchin.
(PNG)
Click here for additional data file.
